sentence.idiomatic: Dinner is ready.
Have you prepared the meeting with the client? I'm ready.
Ms. Li is not yet ready to leave. Please wait a little longer.
Ms. Li doesn't know what gift to buy.
She is having a birthday. Do you know what to buy?
Mr. Wang knows what to buy for the boss.
What kind of tea do you like to drink? I like to drink green tea.
What kind of person is best suited to become a nurse? Attentive people are best suited to become nurses.
What kind of alcohol does Ms. Zhang want to buy? She wants to buy red wine.
And what would you like to drink? I'd like to drink coffee.
What is Mr. Wang thinking? He's thinking about his girlfriend.
I'm really busy lately. How about you? I'm all right.
I normally don't drink coffee in the morning.

word.literal: to go drinking at a bar
to go drinking at a bar

sentence.idiomatic: Where do you usually go drinking? I usually go to the bars on Maoming Road.
What does Ms. Wang usually eat for dinner? She doesn't usually eat dinner.
These companies are all our competitors, especially this one.
They are all diligent workers, especially Mr. Wang.
Foreigners like to drink, especially red wine.
People getting on in years get sick easily.
Mr. Sun is getting on in years, but his mind is still young.
We should respect the elderly.
Tomorrow I'm going to see my girlfriend's dad.
Really? Are you well prepared?
Not yet. I have no idea what gift I should buy.
Does he like to drink tea? Good tea is a good gift.
Yeah. Tea is a very healthy drink. But which kind of tea should I buy?
Good green tea is the safest choice. For example Longjing or Biluochun. Men usually like to drink green tea, and especially older men.
You are right. I'll just give Longjing to her dad.
